 OMFG...I've had tons of crappy jobs... I've worked everything from Fast Food to Picking rocks out of fields in Colorado in the summer. I've screwed tops on to lotion bottles at a Bath, Body, and Beyond factory in Lynchburg, VA. I hate crappy jobs. But I did what I needed to do at the time, all the while looking to do something better. I was never exploited, nobody forced me to do something I didn't ask to do and I was always glad for the paycheck. Here, everyone has the right to get the best job they can (or start their own business) and not take any job they don't want. If you change that, you could get assigned to the sewer patrol. There will always be jobs that are crappier than others to do...but with capitalism, at least those who'd with ability or drive or good ideas can better their situation.
